item.title: 耐克的衰退是消费类股票本周黯淡行情的感叹号
item.description: 就在下个月第二季度财报季正式开始之前，消费类股票本周的惨淡表现引发了人们对美国家庭财务健康状况的担忧。【原文：A dismal week for consumer stocks is raising concern about the financial health of US households just before the second-quarter earnings season begins in earnest next month.】

item.title: 交易商抱怨德国电力市场故障造成损失
item.description: 交易商们抱怨本周德国电力市场出现的信息技术故障造成了不公平的损失。【原文：Traders are complaining about unfair losses made in the German power market because of an IT glitch this week.】

item.title: 中国吉利确认沙特阿美将购买雷诺合资公司 10% 的股份
item.description: 沙特阿美石油公司（Saudi Aramco）将在与法国雷诺汽车公司（Renault SA）和中国浙江吉利控股集团有限公司（Zhejiang Geely Holding Group Co.【原文：Saudi Aramco will take a 10% stake in an automotive joint venture with France’s Renault SA and China’s Zhejiang Geely Holding Group Co., a smaller commitment than originally signaled by the world’s biggest oil company.】

item.title: 智利经济出现复苏迹象，铜供应得到提振
item.description: 智利是世界上最大的电线金属铜供应国，其铜产量正显示出从 20 年低点回升的迹象。【原文：Copper production in Chile, the world’s biggest supplier of the wiring metal, is showing signs of recovering from 20-year lows.】

item.title: 亿万富翁阿加瓦尔将重新控制赞比亚铜矿
item.description: 韦丹塔资源有限公司（Vedanta Resources Ltd.）即将夺回赞比亚孔科拉铜矿的控制权，并计划迅速提高产量，因为预计未来几年需求将激增。【原文：Vedanta Resources Ltd. is close to taking back control of the Konkola copper mine in Zambia and plans to quickly ramp up output as demand is expected to surge in the coming years.】

item.title: 比尔-阿克曼的美国封闭式基金将首次公开募股价格定为每股 50 美元
item.description: 比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）的潘兴广场公司（Pershing Square）将其美国封闭式基金的首次公开发行价定为每股 50 美元，这位亿万富翁的公司正在推进可能成为美国有史以来规模最大的封闭式基金。【原文：Bill Ackman’s Pershing Square set the initial public offering price of its US closed-end vehicle at $50 per share, as the billionaire’s firm moves ahead with what could be the largest ever closed-end fund in the US.】

item.title: 奈拉下跌使其成为上半年表现最差的货币
item.description: 尼日利亚奈拉兑美元汇率连续第九天走低，成为上半年表现最差的货币，原因是大幅贬值、美元流动性不足和市场波动阻碍了阻止奈拉贬值的努力。【原文：Nigeria’s naira weakened for a ninth straight day against the dollar, making it the worst-performing currency in the first half as a steep devaluation, insufficient dollar liquidity and market volatility hampered efforts to stem its rout.】

item.title: 耐克的销售警告导致摩根士丹利、摩根大通等暂停买入耐克股票
item.description: 耐克公司（Nike Inc. ）发出的未来一年经济增长放缓的警告导致几位分析师取消了对该公司股票的买入看涨，使华尔街对其前景的预期跌至六年多来的最低点。【原文：Nike Inc.’s warning of a slower year ahead led several analysts to strip the stock of their buy calls putting Wall Street’s outlook at a more than six-year low.】

item.title: 重大催化剂迫在眉睫，特斯拉投资者做好股价大幅波动的准备
item.description: 特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc. ）股价难得的平静期即将结束，因为投资者要为未来六周的三件大事做好准备，这三件大事可能会让这家电动汽车制造商的股价再次出现剧烈波动。【原文：A rare streak of tranquility in Tesla Inc. shares is about to end, as investors brace for three crucial events over the coming six weeks that could bring back the wild swings often associated with the electric-vehicle maker’s stock.】

item.title: 伦敦金融城未能达成单笔 1 亿英镑的写字楼交易
item.description: 伦敦历史悠久的金融区即将创下一项令人沮丧的纪录：今年上半年，伦敦金融城的写字楼市场没有出现一宗超过 1 亿英镑的交易，这是四分之一世纪以来首次出现这种情况。【原文：London’s historic financial district is on the cusp of notching a grim record: the City’s office market has failed to register a single deal for more than £100 million in the first half of the year — the first time that’s happened in a quarter century.】

item.title: 米莱称立法获胜为货币政策转向铺平道路
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）周五表示，阿根廷政府将在其首次重大立法胜利后改变货币政策框架，以确保其具有里程碑意义的经济改革。【原文：Argentine President Javier Milei said Friday that his government will change its monetary policy framework following his first major legislative victory that secured his landmark economic reforms.】

item.title: 美联储戴利称最新数据显示货币政策正在发挥作用
item.description: 旧金山联邦储备银行行长玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）说，周五公布的通胀数据表明货币政策正在发挥作用，但她表示，现在判断何时适合降低借贷成本还为时过早。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President Mary Daly said inflation data out Friday indicates monetary policy is working, but said it’s too early to tell when it will be appropriate to lower borrowing costs.】

item.title: 塔塔钢铁公司就英国工厂问题与工会发生争执，寻求法律行动
item.description: 塔塔钢铁公司（Tata Steel Ltd.）因决定关闭威尔士塔尔伯特港（Port Talbot）的高炉而与英国工会发生争执，并威胁要采取法律行动。【原文：Tata Steel Ltd. has raised the ante in its tussle with UK’s labor union over its decision to close blast furnaces in the Welsh town of Port Talbot by threatening legal action.】

item.title: 关键通胀数据符合预期，国债上涨
item.description: 在美联储青睐的通胀指标如经济学家预期的那样减速，从而增强了今年开始降息的预期之后，美国国债上涨。【原文：US Treasuries rose after the Federal Reserve’s favored gauge of inflation decelerated as economists expected, bolstering expectations for interest-rate cuts starting this year.】

item.title: 一个激进而务实的领导人：下一个非洲
item.description: 随着这位塞内加尔历史上最年轻的总统执政即将满 100 天，曾担心巴西鲁-迪奥马耶-法耶会开始大刀阔斧改革的投资者们现在开始分辨他在选举前的言辞与正在实施的措施之间的差别。【原文：Alors que le plus jeune président de l’histoire du Sénégal s’approche des 100 jours au pouvoir, les investisseurs qui craignaient que Bassirou Diomaye Faye engage des réformes radicales, font désormais la distinction entre sa rhétorique préélectorale et la réalité des mesures mises en place.】

item.title: 英伟达和加密货币热潮带来的 4000 亿美元狂潮：24 年迄今为止的 ETF 基金
item.description: 对人工智能的炒作、比特币基金的热切期待、数十亿美元流向看似势不可挡的股市大涨：ETF见证了这一切，也是今年迄今为止的受益者。【原文：Hype over artificial intelligence, the eagerly anticipated launch of Bitcoin funds, and billions of dollars flowing toward the seemingly unstoppable stock-market surge: ETFs have seen it all and been the beneficiary so far this year.】

item.title: 伦敦金属交易所将获得香港安慰奖
item.description:
由于无法在中国大陆设立交易所，该交易所正在考虑另谋出路。【原文：

Unable to set up in mainland China, the bourse is considering an alternative.

】

item.title: 股票至上的新时代让尾部风险对冲变得天翻地覆
item.description: 就在大流行病爆发几个月后，丹尼斯-戴维特正忙着向恐慌的客户推销他的看跌投资基金，为下一次市场崩溃做准备。【原文：Just months after the pandemic broke out, Dennis Davitt was busy pitching his bearish investment fund to panic-stricken clients prepping for the next market crash.】

item.title: 兰特引领新兴市场涨势，政治消息令人鼓舞
item.description: 南非兰特因人们乐观地认为建立广泛联合政府的努力已步入正轨而反弹，成为上半年地缘政治风险增加的情况下少数上涨的新兴货币之一。【原文：The South African rand rallied on optimism that efforts to create a broad coalition government were on track, making it one of few emerging currencies to post gains over a first half characterized by increased geopolitical risks.】

item.title: 俄罗斯计划在寻求战争资金的同时提高离婚费用
item.description: 俄罗斯正计划将离婚费提高八倍，以增加莫斯科的财政收入，为总统弗拉基米尔-普京入侵乌克兰提供资金，同时也阻止人们结束婚姻。【原文：Russia is planning to ratchet up eightfold a fee on divorces as Moscow seeks more revenue to fund President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine, while also discouraging people from ending marriage.】

item.title: 初级银行家再次每周工作 100 小时，紧张局势正在加剧
item.description: 要想看到华尔街初级银行家们的压力再次增大，只要再往上看半层，看看工作人员就知道了。【原文：To see the stress mounting again on Wall Street’s junior bankers, just look a half-rung higher, at staffers.】

item.title: 中国铜库存再次减少暗示需求回升
item.description: 中国的铜库存今年以来不断攀升，目前继续下降，这是一个初步迹象，表明全球最大的大宗商品消费国的买家正在回归。【原文：Copper stockpiles in China, which have ballooned this year, continued to slide in a tentative sign that buyers are returning in the world’s biggest consumer of commodities.】

item.title: 在印度的德国企业称官僚主义障碍日益严重
item.description: 与 2023 年相比，今年有更多的德国公司认为印度的官僚主义障碍是在该国开展业务的难题，而这一问题很可能成为德国总理奥拉夫-肖尔茨今年晚些时候访问南亚国家时会谈的重点。【原文：More German companies cited bureaucratic hurdles in India as a problem to doing business in the country this year than in 2023, an issue that will likely feature in talks when Chancellor Olaf Scholz visits the South Asian nation later this year.】

item.title: 微软价值 130 亿美元的 OpenAI 协议面临欧盟额外审查
item.description: 微软公司对OpenAI公司130亿美元的投资将受到欧盟反垄断监督机构的进一步审查，他们准备就该人工智能公司独家使用微软云技术的问题质询竞争对手。【原文：Microsoft Corp.’s $13 billion investment into OpenAI Inc. is set to come under added scrutiny from European Union’s antitrust watchdogs, who are poised to quiz rivals about the AI firm’s exclusive use of Microsoft’s cloud technology.】

item.title: 华尔街警察 Finra 因案件量骤降而保持沉默
item.description: 圣诞节后两天，华尔街一家知名监管机构更新了一个数据库，其中包含业界感兴趣的新闻：一家市值 1.4 万亿美元的经纪公司因涉嫌遗失近百万笔交易记录而被处以本年度最大的罚款之一。【原文：Two days after Christmas, a prominent Wall Street regulator updated a database with news of interest to the industry: A $1.4 trillion brokerage had been slapped with one of the year’s biggest fines for allegedly losing track of almost a million trades.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。交易员为美联储首选的通胀指标做好准备，日元干预的赌注上升，拜登总统的辩论陷入困境，耐克股价暴跌。以下是市场动态。【原文：Good morning. Traders brace for the Fed’s preferred inflation measure, wagers on yen intervention rise, President Biden’s debate woes and Nike shares tumble. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Sam Unsted】

item.title: 顶级化肥生产商称 "黑天鹅 "冲击终于有所缓解
item.description: 这家全球最大的农作物养分生产商表示，化肥需求刚刚开始从过去几年的剧烈震荡中稳定下来，过去几年的震荡使该公司的利润大幅波动。【原文：The world’s biggest maker of crop nutrients said fertilizer demand is just now starting to stabilize from seismic shocks of the past few years that left the company with wild profit swings.】

item.title: 欧莱雅预计中国美容市场增长放缓
item.description: 欧莱雅集团首席执行官表示，由于中国市场在多年快速增长后出现疲软，拖累了销售额，预计今年整个美容市场的增长将放缓。【原文：L’Oreal SA expects slower growth for the overall beauty market this year, according to its CEO, as weakness in China weighs on sales after years of rapid gains.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦称欧洲央行可无视通货紧缩中的颠簸
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，欧洲央行可以透过欧元区通胀统计数据的一次性波动来看待问题。【原文：The European Central Bank can look through one-off fluctuations in euro-area inflation statistics, according to Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau.】
